 63 -class UnivariateSpline(Spline): 

 64      """ 
 65      Model of a function of a single variable using spline fitting. 
 66      """ 
 67   

 68 -    def __init__(self, x, y, order=3, stddev=0): 

 69          """ 
 70          Construct spline. 
 71   
 72          @param x: Length N, monotonically increasing sequence of input values. 
 73          @param y: Length N sequence of output values. 
 74          @param order: Order of spline to fit, 1 <= k <= 5. Odd orders are 
 75              recommended. 
 76          @param stddev: Standard deviation in output values. If non-zero, the 
 77              resulting spline will be smoothed within this constraint. 
 78          """ 
 79          splineKwArgs = {'k':order} 
 80          if stddev != 0: 
 81              w = np.zeros_like(x) 
 82              w.fill(1/stddev) 
 83              splineKwArgs['w']=w 
 84          else: 
 85              splineKwArgs['s']=0 
 86   
 87          if len(x) <= order: 
 88              raise Spline.InsufficientPointsError, \ 
 89                  "%d points insufficient for order %d spline" % (len(x), order) 
 90   
 91          self._tck = splrep(x,y,**splineKwArgs) 
 92   
 93          self._validFrom = x[self._boundaryPoints] 
 94          self._validTo = x[-(self._boundaryPoints + 1)] 

 95   
 96      @property 

 97 -    def _boundaryPoints(self): 

 98          return int(math.ceil(self._tck[2]/2)) 

 99   
100      @property 

101 -    def validFrom(self): 

102          return self._validFrom 

103   
104      @property 

105 -    def validTo(self): 

106          return self._validTo 

107   

108 -    def __call__(self,x,n=0): 

109          """ 
110          Evaluate the n-th derivative of the function at input value(s) x. 
111          """ 
112          return splev(x, self._tck, n)

114 -class PartialInputSpline(Spline): 

115      """ 
116      Piecewise spline that allows for undefined values in the output domain. 
117   
118      Splines are generated for each region in which there is valid data. 
119   
120      This class implements 1D to 1D fitting using L{UnivariateSpline}. It can 
121      be subclassed to accomodate other output types by overriding the 
122      _splineClass attribute, and the _validity and _output methods. 
123      """ 
124      _splineClass = UnivariateSpline 
125   

126 -    def __init__(self, x, y, **kwargs): 

127          """ 
128          Construct partial input spline. 
129   
130          @param x: Values in the input domain of the spline. 
131          @param y: Values in the output domain of the spline. 
132          @param kwargs: Additional arguments to pass to spline constructors. 
133          """ 
134   
135          # Find indices and x values at which the array becomes (in)valid. 
136          valid = np.array([False] + list(self._validity(y)) + [False]) 
137          lastValid = np.roll(valid, 1) 
138          nextValid = np.roll(valid, -1) 
139          changed = valid ^ lastValid 
140          becameValid = valid & changed 
141          starting = becameValid & nextValid 
142          ending = lastValid & valid & ~nextValid 
143          starts = list(starting.nonzero()[0] - 1) 
144          ends = list(ending.nonzero()[0] - 1) 
145   
146          self.splines = [] 
147          for start, end in zip(starts, ends): 
148              try: 
149                  xvals = x[start:end+1] 
150                  if len(np.shape(y)) == 1: 
151                      yvals = y[start:end+1] 
152                  else: 
153                      yvals = y[:,start:end+1] 
154                  self.splines.append(self._splineClass(xvals,yvals, **kwargs)) 
155              except Spline.InsufficientPointsError: 
156                  starts.remove(start) 
157                  ends.remove(end) 
158   
159          if len(self.splines) == 0: 
160              raise Spline.InsufficientPointsError, \ 
161                  "No valid regions long enough to create a spline" 
162   
163          xstarts = [s.validFrom for s in self.splines] 
164          xends = [s.validTo for s in self.splines] 
165          self.validRegions = zip(xstarts, xends) 
166          self.regions = zip(xstarts, xends, self.splines) 

167   

168 -    def _validity(self, y): 

169          """ 
170          Return a boolean array indicating where y is valid. 
171   
172          This method should be overridden by subclasses using other data types. 
173          """ 
174          return ~np.isnan(y) 

175   

176 -    def _output(self, x, conditions, results, undefined): 

177          """ 
178          Create combined output array from partial results and default values. 
179   
180          This method should be overridden by subclasses using other data types. 
181   
182          @param x: Input values, length N L{np.ndarray}. 
183          @param conditions: List of length N boolean arrays identifying the 
184              indices of x for which each set of results should be applied. 
185          @param results: List of spline results, types as appropriate, with 
186              lengths corresponding to the number of True values in each 
187              condition array. 
188          @param undefined: Boolean array of length N indicating indices of x 
189              which should be filled with default values. 
190   
191          @return: Output of length N, type as appropriate. 
192          """ 
193          out = np.empty_like(np.atleast_1d(x)) 
194   
195          for condition, result in izip(conditions, results): 
196              out[condition] = result 
197   
198          out[undefined] = np.nan 
199   
200          if np.isscalar(x): 
201              return out[0] 
202          else: 
203              return out 

204   

205 -    def __call__(self, x, *args, **kwargs): 

206          X = np.atleast_1d(x) 
207          conditions = np.atleast_2d([(X>=start) & (X<=end) 
208              for start,end in self.validRegions]) 
209          undefined = ~np.any(conditions, axis=0) 
210          if np.all(undefined): 
211              results = [] 
212              conditions = [] 
213          else: 
214              results, conditions = zip(*[(s(X[c], *args, **kwargs), c) 
215                  for c,s in izip(conditions, self.splines) if X[c].size > 0]) 
216          return self._output(x, conditions, results, undefined)

218      @property 

219 -    def validFrom(self): 

220          return self.splines[0].validFrom

222      @property 

223 -    def validTo(self): 

224          return self.splines[-1].validTo
